image.altText: a dead dolphin floats

items.synopsis: Three dead dolphins turn up in an oil spill. The energy company says it's got nothing to do with it, but Alex, an insider, sets out to prove it wrong. Now, an ABC investigation has revealed mistakes were made.

title.children: 'I work somewhere that can kill dolphins': Why this Santos worker spoke out

image.altText: A young man with his blond hair combed back smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: The headmaster of Shore School in Sydney has been criticised over a newsletter he wrote describing Lilie James's accused murderer as an "absolute delight".

title.children: Elite Sydney school principal criticised for saying Lilie James's accused killer was 'not a monster'

image.altText: soldiers advancing in smoke

items.synopsis: With its troops sweeping through Gaza, Israel has been unafraid to exploit its enormous advantages — and the Palestinian death toll is climbing. But Israelis may be about to face a new threat, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: After a week of destruction in Gaza, the Palestinian death toll is climbing — and Israelis are facing a new threat

image.altText: Palestinians pull a damaged ambulance after it was hit in a strike.

items.synopsis: Israel says the ambulance strike in Gaza City was targeting Hamas militants, while Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejects calls for a ceasefire unless hostages are released.

title.children: Several reported killed in Israeli attack on ambulance convoy near Gaza's largest hospital

image.altText: An outback setting

items.synopsis: Emergency services have rushed to the scene where a light aircraft carrying three people has crashed near Cloncurry, in north-west Queensland.

title.children: Three dead after firefighting plane crashes in outback Queensland

image.altText: Young baby at Childcare, Queenstown

items.synopsis: Adel Farr was prepared to leave her beloved west coast community in Tasmania to follow her career aspirations of working with children. Then she found out she didn't have to.

title.children: Community in remote region finding a way to tackle childcare staffing shortage

image.altText: A young man with round face, wearing a beige shirt and camouflage jacket, is escorted as cameras flash nearby

items.synopsis: In a remote island community in the Philippines, a young man convinced villagers he was their saviour. Now, he is accused of leading a doomsday cult and fostering child marriages, rape, forced labour and human trafficking.

title.children: An alleged cult stayed hidden in the mountains for years until followers broke free. These are their stories

image.altText: A graphic of Mark McGowan on an old television with the words 'A form of terrorism'

items.synopsis: Advocates say WA's juvenile detention system is broken, and the government continues to fall back on empty rhetoric and platitudes. These are the questions they want it to answer.

title.children: 'A necessary evil': Asking the WA government the hardest questions on youth detention

image.altText: A group of solar panels on a roof through the frame of leafy trees.

items.synopsis: While most Australians are stuck with inflated fixed-rate power prices, some are saving money by playing the spot market. So how are they doing it, and why isn't it for everyone?

title.children: Consumers tapping the spot power market are cleaning up, covering 'a month's bill' in a night

image.altText: Lightning appears through a black storm cloud

items.synopsis: There has been a marked shift in the weather pattern across eastern Australia during the past 48 hours. The result will be a week-long spell of showers and thunderstorms from tropical Queensland to eastern Victoria.

title.children: Week-long spell of rain and storms for eastern states as north and west swelter

image.altText: storm clouds over a field

items.synopsis: Up to 15 millimetres of rain has already fallen overnight in affected areas, including Tara, in the Western Downs — which has born the brunt of the bushfires —  and Wallangarra.

title.children: Bushfire-stricken regions in southern Queensland and northern NSW get a soaking with more rain forecast

image.altText: Red flames light up the night sky.

items.synopsis: More than 300 people were forced to evacuate when a huge fire ripped through dozens of homes in the southern Queensland community of Tara. Now the residents are coming to grips with the devastation while looking to the future.

title.children: Johann woke to kelpie Mickey barking at something outside. He took this photo then fled for his life

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Scott Morrison

items.synopsis: When he gets off the plane in China, not being Scott Morrison will help Anthony Albanese, but it only goes so far in stabilising relations in the long term, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Albanese got a jump start on the world stage thanks to his predecessor

image.altText: British comedian Russell Brand performs.

items.synopsis: The suit follows a recent flurry of allegations made against the 48-year-old performer by several women accusing him of sexual assault and inappropriate behaviour.

title.children: UK comedian Russell Brand facing further sexual assault allegations in New York lawsuit

image.altText: Kiwis players and coaches celebrate defeating the Kangaroos in the Pacific Championships final.

items.synopsis: Considered underdogs heading into the Pacific Championships final, New Zealand stuns World Cup winners Australia with a 30-0 victory in Hamilton.

title.children: Kiwis hammer Kangaroos in record-breaking win to claim Pacific Championships title

image.altText: James McDonald rides Riff Rocket to victory in Victoria Derby at Flemington.

items.synopsis: Ridden superbly by star jockey James McDonald, Riff Rocket edges out Apulia to triumph in the Victoria Derby at Flemington.

title.children: Riff Rocket storms home to win Victoria Derby in photo finish

image.altText: A graphic displaying a number of jockeys.

items.synopsis: Irish galloper Vauban looks set to run favourite in Tuesday's great race, but who will be the toughest to beat? Explore our interactive form guide to the horses set to line up in the 163rd Melbourne Cup.

title.children: The 2023 Melbourne Cup field has been decided. Here's your guide to the runners

image.altText: Alisha Boe (left) wears a white 1870s wedding dress as she cheerses to four other women in emerald gowns.

items.synopsis: We've got an eerie Tiger King vibes outback mystery, we've got a swoon-worthy period drama, we've got titillatingly erotic stories, and we've got the identical twin dating show you didn't know you needed. Here are our top five new-to-streaming shows this month.

title.children: You can stop flicking aimlessly through streamers. Here are five new shows we think you’ll love

image.altText: Police cordon off a road near bushlad

items.synopsis: A man has been shot in the head in an incident which forced a town east of Perth into lockdown for four hours, but police say there is no longer an immediate threat to public safety.

title.children: 'Scary as hell': Man in critical condition after being shot in the head east of Perth

image.altText: Jackie Fahey, Grace Lam, Jodie Barber, Sharon Marlow and Liz Depers

items.synopsis: Women are being thrust back to the most severe stages of menopause amid long-running shortages of hormone replacement therapy patches.

title.children: Women bursting into tears at chemists as months-long hormone replacement patch shortage takes its toll

image.altText: A woman's heavily tattooed right arm, holding a cup of coffee

items.synopsis: Here's what you need to know about decaf coffee: how it's made, the flavour, the benefits — and whether it's actually caffeine-free.

title.children: How is decaf coffee made? And is it really caffeine-free?

image.altText: A fire vehicle backlit by an intense blaze

items.synopsis: Police believe several recent bushfires that threatened homes and residents in Queensland were started on purpose. Motivations for arson can vary but will be key to investigations.

title.children: What do we know about why arsonists light fires?

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason photographed in court.

items.synopsis: The state's Attorney-General says he is taking the matter "very seriously" and the Chief Justice has asked the judge, whom the ABC understands to be Gregory Geason, to take leave "until further notice".

title.children: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge stood down in relation to 'significant matter'

image.altText: A Fijian man dressed in Israeli attire

items.synopsis: Six Pacific Island countries have voted with Israel to oppose the UN resolution for a ceasefire in Gaza. For many nations in the region, the connection to Israel runs deep.

title.children: 'I believe it': The 'lost tribes' of Israel theory runs deep in the Pacific, as modern conflict sparks division

image.altText: A man stands on a red dirt road next to a sign with a bird on it, and a blue sky.

items.synopsis: Every year, Mick Roderick commits to an "obsessive" Twitchathon race across the countryside. This year it's helping save one of Australia's rarest birds.

title.children: For 25 years there's been one event this passionate birdwatcher won't miss

image.altText: Santa in his red suit waving from his sleigh with confetti flying

items.synopsis: Children and adults alike put on their best Christmas outfits and head to Adelaide for the largest public parade in the southern hemisphere.

title.children: People lined streets as early as midnight for iconic Christmas event

image.altText: A man works in a furnace wearing protective equipment.

items.synopsis: One of the world's biggest mining companies is pulling out of Australian copper despite growing demand for the renewable energy metal. What does that mean for Australia's role plugging the critical minerals gap?

title.children: Glencore is ditching Australian copper. What does it mean for our critical minerals industry?

image.altText: Douglas Cannon standing outside his house at Dalrymple Heights with his two children Violet and Sterling

items.synopsis: Eighty picturesque properties in north Queensland could be resumed for the world's largest pumped hydro scheme. More than a year after they learnt of the project, residents' futures remain in limbo.

title.children: Douglas and his family built a 'special' life in Pioneer Valley. He says it's gut-wrenching it could all be destroyed

image.altText: A picture of Matthew Perry with the text "the one where we lost a friend" and a broken heart emoji in a bouquet of flowers

items.synopsis: I've been ineffably sad ever since the awful news of Matthew Perry's death. The first fatal rupture within an iconic cultural group — a band, an acting ensemble — is the true death of the group itself, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: I lived in the iconic 'Friends' apartment and I loved Chandler most. I'm ineffably sad about Matthew Perry's death

image.altText: A young bull rider hangs on with one hand as the animal gets airborne in a ring surrounded by cowboy spectators.

items.synopsis: Twelve-year-old mini-bull rider Ronan Miosge is one tough hombre. He has been bucked off mini bulls since he was eight and keeps coming back for more.

title.children: Queensland rodeo prodigy takes on world's best at mini-bull riding championships in Texas

image.altText: Nepal earthquake survivors

items.synopsis: At least 128 people have been killed and dozens injured after a magnitude-6.4 earthquake struck western Nepal on Friday, with witnesses saying houses in the area collapsed and buildings as far as New Delhi, India, shook.

title.children: Death toll exceeds 100 after magnitude-6.4 earthquake hits Nepal

image.altText: A grandstand roof is shown collapsed at the Brazilian F1 Grand Prix in Sao Paolo, Brazil.

items.synopsis: Qualifying at the Brazilian Grand Prix was stopped earlier due to "crazy" unpredictable weather, but predictably enough, Max Verstappen survived the drama to qualify on pole for the 11th time this Formula 1 season.

title.children: 'Crazy' weather sees grandstands destroyed at Brazilian Grand Prix

image.altText: A brown skinned woman and man stand next to each other outside a weatherboard house, the woman is holding a black dog.

items.synopsis: Neil Para and his family lived in Australia for more than nine years with no visa and no rights. What's life like now they've been granted permanent residency?

title.children: After almost 10 years living with no rights, permanent residency allows Para family to finally look to the future

image.altText: A man with a high vis shirt on and a backwards hat, giving the camera a thumbs up

items.synopsis: On a stifling hot day in the Kimberley, the 22-year-old drove away from his family in a vehicle packed with food and water. The 4WD and its contents were found a week later — but the young stockman remains missing.

title.children: A year ago today, Wylie Oscar disappeared without a trace. So many questions remain unanswered

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

items.synopsis: A beef wellington lunch allegedly led to three deaths and a small south-east Victorian community in shock. Now the host has been charged with murder. Here's how it all unfolded.

title.children: How a sleepy Gippsland town made global headlines after a mushroom lunch allegedly killed three guests
